001package com.technototes.library.hardware2;
002
003import java.util.function.Consumer;
004
005import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.navigation.AxesOrder;
006
007import com.qualcomm.hardware.bosch.BNO055IMU;
008import com.qualcomm.hardware.bosch.BNO055IMUImpl;
009
010/**
011 * TODO: Remove this. I don't believe this adds much value. Yeah, HardwareMap.get is weird, but
012 * it's in all the documentation, so just read it, see it in the examples, and you're done.
013 */
014@Deprecated
015public class IMUBuilder extends HardwareBuilder<BNO055IMU> {
016
017    public enum AxesSigns {
018        PPP(0b000),
019        PPN(0b001),
020        PNP(0b010),
021        PNN(0b011),
022        NPP(0b100),
023        NPN(0b101),
024        NNP(0b110),
025        NNN(0b111);
026
027        public final int bVal;
028
029        AxesSigns(int bVal) {
030            this.bVal = bVal;
031        }
032    }
033
034    private BNO055IMU.Parameters parameters;
035
036    public IMUBuilder(String name) {
037        super(name);
038        parameters = new BNO055IMU.Parameters();
039    }
040
041    public IMUBuilder(BNO055IMUImpl device) {
042        super(device);
043        parameters = new BNO055IMU.Parameters();
044    }
045
046    public IMUBuilder parameter(Consumer<BNO055IMU.Parameters> consumer) {
047        consumer.accept(parameters);
048        return this;
049    }
050
051    public IMUBuilder degrees() {
052        parameters.angleUnit = BNO055IMU.AngleUnit.DEGREES;
053        return this;
054    }
055
056    public IMUBuilder radians() {
057        parameters.angleUnit = BNO055IMU.AngleUnit.RADIANS;
058        return this;
059    }
060
061    public IMUBuilder remap(AxesOrder order, AxesSigns signs) {
062        try {
063            // the indices correspond with the 2-bit encodings specified in the datasheet
064            int[] indices = order.indices();
065            int axisMapConfig = 0;
066            axisMapConfig |= (indices[0] << 4);
067            axisMapConfig |= (indices[1] << 2);
068            axisMapConfig |= (indices[2]);
069
070            // the BNO055 driver flips the first orientation vector so we also flip here
071            int axisMapSign = signs.bVal ^ (0b100 >> indices[0]);
072
073            // Enter CONFIG mode
074            product.write8(BNO055IMU.Register.OPR_MODE, BNO055IMU.SensorMode.CONFIG.bVal & 0x0F);
075
076            Thread.sleep(100);
077
078            // Write the AXIS_MAP_CONFIG register
079            product.write8(BNO055IMU.Register.AXIS_MAP_CONFIG, axisMapConfig & 0x3F);
080
081            // Write the AXIS_MAP_SIGN register
082            product.write8(BNO055IMU.Register.AXIS_MAP_SIGN, axisMapSign & 0x07);
083
084            // Switch back to the previous mode
085            product.write8(BNO055IMU.Register.OPR_MODE, product.getParameters().mode.bVal & 0x0F);
086
087            Thread.sleep(100);
088        } catch (InterruptedException e) {
089            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
090        }
091        parameters = product.getParameters();
092        return this;
093    }
094
095    @Override
096    public <U extends BNO055IMU> U build() {
097        product.initialize(parameters);
098        return (U) product;
099    }
100}
